name: 彭尉祖
objective: This course introduces the fundamental principles of nanoscience and nanotechnology, with emphasis on size effect on material properties, fabrication processes, and characterization methods. Widespread applications, including semiconductors, biomedical, soft materials, and energy, are highlighted to broaden students' perspectives and enhance their understanding of nanotechnology's potential in future innovations.
schedule:
Week 1 (9/9): Overview of nanotechnology
Week 2 (9/16): Crystals structure 
Week 3 (9/23): Characterization I: imaging
Week 4 (9/30): Characterization II: spectroscopy & structure
Week 5 (10/7): Bottom-up approach I: epitaxy, self-assembly techniques
Week 6 (10/14): Bottom-up approach I: deposition
Week 7 (10/21): Top-down approach I: lithography, ion implantation
Week 8 (10/28): Top-down approach II: etching, chemical mechanical polishing
Week 9 (11/4): Midterm report
Week 10 (11/11): Nanotechnology in semiconductor fabrication I: CMOS
Week 11 (11/18): Nanotechnology in semiconductor fabrication I: CoWoS
Week 12 (11/25): Nanomaterials I: Carbon-allotropes
Week 13 (12/2): Nanomaterials II: functional system
Week 14 (12/9): Nanotechnology applied in Energy
Week 15 (12/16): Nanotechnology applied in biomedicine
Week 16 (12/23): Nanotechnology applied in soft material
Week 17 (12/30): Advanced frontiers
Week 16 (1/6): Final project report
